9d0741fa-dac1-436e-84be-2d2d8c56ce40: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A chicken's master gains +3 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} and a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.

A viper's master gains a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion checks{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
9d7eaa79-c8be-4bea-971c-f3d8ebfcec53: A scroll savant adds half his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} (minimum 1) as a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device checks{/g}. He will always take 10 on Use Magic Device {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} from a scroll if 10 on a {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} is enough for a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g}.
4dc2ce79-874b-41ed-a6d1-b4d6cb67a784:
A wizard can choose to specialize in one {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}school of magic{/g}, gaining additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and powers based on that school. This choice must be made at 1st level, and once made, it cannot be changed. A wizard that does not select a school receives the universalist school instead.
Each arcane school gives the wizard a number of school powers. In addition, specialist wizards receive an additional spell slot of each spell level he can cast, from 1st on up. Each day, a wizard can prepare a spell from his specialty school in that slot. This spell must be in the wizard's spellbook. A wizard can select a spell modified by a metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} to prepare in his school slot, but it uses up a higher-level spell slot. Wizards with the universalist school do not receive a school slot.
c17d559c-4cdd-44e3-b46f-7748896db308: A wizard that chooses to specialize in one {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}school of magic{/g} must select two other schools as his opposition schools, representing knowledge sacrificed in one area of arcane lore to gain mastery in another. A wizard who prepares {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} from his opposition schools must use two spell slots of that level to prepare the spell.
648cfc20-7134-4df0-851c-356f4ebd804f: Abjurations are protective {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. They create physical or magical barriers, negate magical or physical abilities, harm trespassers, or even banish the subject of the spell to another plane of existence.
ec82e7b5-0b66-40f1-aeb5-98a6252a7f8c: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can create a 10-foot-radius field of protective magic centered on you that lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. All allies in this area (including you) receive a +1 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier.
176bd3e3-6bbf-4c62-9a96-7d1ce8c954ff: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can make a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} that causes a living creature to become shaken for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum 1). If you touch a shaken creature with this ability, it becomes frightened for 1 round if it has fewer {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} than your wizard level.[LONGSTART] You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.[LONGEND]
1e224ab5-0908-4dca-8132-c31acf262049: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can strike with a telekinetic fist, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. The telekinetic fist deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} + 1 for every two wizard levels you possess.[LONGSTART] You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.[LONGEND]
3d38060b-07c1-4bd0-9e10-5c5c7f2da6ca: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can unleash a force missile that automatically strikes a foe, as magic missile. The force missile deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} plus the damage from your Intense Spells evocation power.[LONGSTART] This is a force effect. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.[LONGEND]
3070a24b-c675-4061-8fce-9edf2934dd54: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can unleash an acid dart targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. The acid dart deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} + 1 for every two wizard levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. This {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} ignores {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}.
328870c7-d218-4c61-9478-3aa0d6d14218: At 10th level, a scroll savant can use his own {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} instead of the item's caster level when using a scroll.
6dba39f1-4d8c-44bc-8d2e-606170aacf99:
At 12th level, you can empower your next {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} as though using the Empower Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. Empowering costs 2 daily usages of metamagic mastery.
Empower Spell: All variable, numeric effects of an empowered spell are increased by half, including {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to those {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}dice{/g} rolls.
{g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Saving throws{/g} and opposed rolls are not affected, nor are spells without random variables.
156d8f47-828d-4313-9597-0182e57cf2c0:
At 16th level, you can maximize your next {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} as though using the Maximize Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. Maximizing costs 3 daily usages of metamagic mastery.
Maximize Spell: All variable, numeric effects of a spell modified by this feat are maximized. {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Saving throws{/g} and opposed {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} are not affected, nor are spells without random variables.
d1316fab-d71f-46f9-be1d-7a302b7b7b91: At 1st level and every 4 levels thereafter, the exploiter wizard gains a single arcanist exploit. An exploiter wizard exploit cannot be selected more than once. Once an exploiter wizard exploit has been selected, it cannot be changed. Most exploiter wizard exploits require the exploiter wizard to expend points from her arcane reservoir to function. Unless otherwise noted, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for an exploiter wizard exploit is equal to 10 + half the wizard's level + the wizard's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
7b053d66-d2d5-4fe2-a872-613abc26fdf6:
At 1st level, an elemental specialist selects one element. He gains the ability to convert elemental {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} into his chosen element.
At 15th level, his spells of the chosen element also deal half of the damage as untyped damage.
8b1fe508-c33b-4da0-8fe9-f1bbd866d703: At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, an arcane bomber can sacrifice one of his {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to empower the next bomb he throws during his turn. When he does, he gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to hit with the next bomb he throws before the end of his turn equal to the level of the spell he sacrificed, and a bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to twice the level of the spell.
498d55c4-bec0-4889-a98d-175380948f80: At 1st level, once per day the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} master's understanding of spells allows him to increase his {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} by 4 for a single spell cast. He can do this twice per day at 8th level, and three times per day at 16th level.
9ab57b9f-34de-4927-b910-beae3a12a1cd:
At 1st level, the arcane bomber gains an ability nearly identical to the alchemist's bomb ability. Unlike the alchemist, at 1st level, the arcane bomber chooses one type of energy from the following list: acid, cold, fire, and electricity. He can throw bombs of that type, but cannot modify them with discoveries. An arcane bomber can use a number of bombs each day equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} + his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
Thrown bombs have a range of 30 feet and use the Throw Splash Weapon special {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. Bombs are considered weapons and can be selected using {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} such as Point-Blank Shot and Weapon Focus. On a direct hit, an arcane bomber's bomb inflicts {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the chosen energy type + additional damage equal to the arcane bomber's Intelligence modifier. The damage of an arcane bomber's bomb increases by 1d6 points at every odd-numbered arcane bomber level. Splash damage from an arcane bomber's bomb is always equal to the bomb's minimum damage (so if the bomb would deal 2d6+4 points of damage of the chosen energy type on a direct hit, its splash damage would be 6 points of damage of chosen energy type). Those caught in the splash damage can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the arcane bomber's level + the arcane bomber's Intelligence modifier.
12354113-f28b-4999-98ba-6656f44db03c: At 1st level, wizards form a powerful bond with an object or a creature. This bond can take one of two forms: a familiar or a bonded object. A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the wizard's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses, while a bonded object is an item a wizard can use to cast additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
5267d29b-db6a-4169-8ef8-9d1b5fd03136: At 1st, 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th level, a wizard gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. At each such opportunity, he can choose a metamagic feat, spell focus feat, or any other {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcaster{/g} feat. The wizard must still meet all prerequisites for a bonus feat, including {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} minimums.
c50c245f-7876-4ebc-bb58-5d02568355e0: At 20th level, a cruoromancer can use his blood infusions without taking {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
06a542dc-9b1a-4827-970f-dd3c15f6cd53: At 20th level, anytime you {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g}, assume the roll resulted in a natural 20.
d313ea1c-69c9-414d-b850-2a18b0a880b8: At 20th level, whenever you cast an Evocation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, you can {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice to penetrate a creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} and take the better result.
4802e22f-0ebe-4fde-aec0-cd0afc6bc5a6:
At 20th level, you can quicken your next {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} as though using the Quicken Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. Quickening costs 4 daily usages of metamagic mastery.
Quicken Spell: Casting a quickened spell is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. You can perform another {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, even casting another spell, in the same {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as you cast a quickened spell. A spell whose {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g} is more than 1 round or 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} cannot be quickened.
2c0897fc-1620-4a6f-bc8d-534d9b0b9438: At 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter, a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} master gains an additional use of his arcane bond — object class feature.
7625c32a-d558-464c-b84d-b9a02c65c5dc: At 5th level, whenever the scroll savant uses a scroll, he calculates the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} it contains using his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier, instead of the minimum modifier needed to cast a spell of that level.
b22a275c-0b57-4733-8c92-02bcf302f004: At 6th level, you gain an amount of energy absorption equal to 3 times your wizard level per day. Whenever you take {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} apply the rest to this absorption, reducing your daily total by that amount. Any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} in excess of your absorption is applied to you normally.
23e43512-daf7-4920-a221-2d98ca8544ff:
At 8th level, once per day you can create a wall of energy. You can choose fire, cold, acid, or {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}.
An immobile, blazing curtain of the chosen energy springs into existence. The wall deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the chosen energy type when it appears, and to all creatures in the area on your turn each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The wall also deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of damage of the chosen energy type + 1 point of that type per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +20) to any creature passing through it. The wall deals double damage to undead creatures.
At 12th level and every 4 levels thereafter, you can use this ability one additional time per day, to a maximum of 4 times at level 20.
880be082-ce23-44e5-803e-dd4c38fb28c7: At 8th level, you can change your shape for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive. This ability otherwise functions like beast shape II or elemental body I. At 12th level, this ability functions like beast shape III or elemental body II.
5ad13435-8e4a-47a8-bbbd-7d90d074121f: At 8th level, you can emit a 30-foot aura of despair for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your wizard level. Enemies within this aura take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. These rounds do not need to be consecutive. This is a mind-affecting effect.
4e59b26f-ccbd-4504-9459-57fcc1648d71:
At 8th level, you can extend or alter the range of your next {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} as though using the Extend Spell or Reach Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} accordingly. You can use this ability once per day at 8th level and one additional time per day for every two wizard levels you possess beyond 8th.
Extend Spell: An extended spell lasts twice as long as normal. A spell with a duration of {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration{/g}, instantaneous, or permanent is not affected by this feat.
Reach Spell: You can alter a spell with a range of touch, close, or medium to increase its range by one range category, using the following order: touch, close, medium, and long. Spells modified by this feat that require melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} instead require ranged touch {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.
f2282210-2a73-41bf-8798-2202148ae772: At 8th level, you can make yourself invisible as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive. This otherwise functions as greater invisibility.
bb7bf9eb-540f-4789-aaeb-40fb74e40e77: At 8th level, you can use this ability to teleport up to 30 feet as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. You can use this ability a total number of times per day equal to your wizard level.
67ebfac6-0308-4c35-a3c9-78ca791ac38a: At 8th level, you can utter a prediction of the immediate future. While your foretelling is in effect, you emit a 30-foot aura of fortune that aids your allies or hinders your enemies, as chosen by you at the time of prediction. If you choose to aid, you and your allies gain a +2 luck {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. If you choose to hinder, your enemies take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on those {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} instead. You can use this ability for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
346b0218-be7b-4bde-be89-f1607aba8982: At 8th level, you can utter a prediction of the immediate future. While your foretelling is in effect, you emit a 30-foot aura of fortune that aids your allies. You and your allies gain a +2 luck {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. You can use this ability for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
8ac3a43c-5d19-4861-8c12-640284d62458: At 8th level, you can utter a prediction of the immediate future. While your foretelling is in effect, you emit a 30-foot aura of fortune that hinders your enemies. Your enemies take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. You can use this ability for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
b97adcad-b3f5-403d-903b-50968d4da9e5: At 8th level, you gain blindsight to a range of 10 feet for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your wizard level. This ability only allows you to detect living creatures and undead creatures. This sight also tells you whether a creature is living or undead. Constructs and other creatures that are neither living nor undead cannot be seen with this ability. The range of this ability increases by 10 feet at 12th level, and by an additional 10 feet for every four levels beyond 12th. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
3cc9661e-78fe-4376-b9c6-6234ec32e9a4:
Benefits: A Thassilonian specialist wizard receives two additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slots of each spell level he can cast. These bonus spell slots must both be used to prepare the same spell from the wizard's school of specialization, allowing the wizard to cast that spell twice. The wizard cannot use these slots to prepare two different spells, even if they are of the school he is specialized in.
Restrictions: A Thassilonian specialist does not get to customize his choice for opposition schools — that choice is selected for him when he chooses his specialization. These restrictions are more significant than those most wizards follow, and are known as prohibited schools. A Thassilonian wizard can never prepare a spell that is in one of his prohibited schools — he treats these spells as if they were not on the wizard spell list. If using a spell trigger or spell completion item to cast a spell from one of his prohibited schools, he must use the {g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} to do so.
fd6a6892-8aad-45bb-bc02-4e5b90b1dbc7: Conjurations transport creatures from another plane of existence to your plane (calling); create objects or effects on the spot (creation); {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} (healing); bring manifestations of objects, creatures, or forms of energy to you (summoning); or transport creatures or objects over great distances (teleportation). Creatures you conjure usually — but not always — obey your commands.
4320dfca-c3fe-4307-984e-702b665ecdef: Contrary to traditional wizardly study, an exploiter wizard forgoes the tried and true methods of arcane focus and arcane schools for the exploits favored by an arcanist. Some wizards regard this blatant exploitation of arcane magic as somehow "cheating," but most exploiters believe this prejudice is close-minded and overly traditional.
625f81c6-457d-4198-9047-e053072263f5: Divination {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} enable you to learn secrets long forgotten, predict the future, find hidden things, and foil deceptive spells.
1f551882-ea00-43d0-939f-21919f22acc2:
Diviners are masters of remote viewing, prophecies, and using magic to explore the world.
Forewarned: You receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1). At 20th level, anytime you {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} initiative, assume the roll resulted in a natural 20.
Diviner's Fortune: When you activate this school power, you can touch any creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to give it an insight bonus on all of its {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1) for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
Foretell: At 8th level, you can utter a prediction of the immediate future. While your foretelling is in effect, you emit a 30-foot aura of fortune that aids your allies or hinders your enemies, as chosen by you at the time of prediction. If you choose to aid, you and your allies gain a +2 luck bonus on ability checks, attack rolls, {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} checks, saving throws, and skill checks. If you choose to hinder, your enemies take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on those rolls instead. You can use this ability for a number of rounds per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
10843b11-0239-4d26-908b-97e0fbf9eba8:
Enchanting Smile: You gain a +2 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion checks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against Enchantment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess, up to a maximum of +6 at 20th level.
Dazing Touch: You can cause a living creature to become dazed for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. Creatures with more {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} than your wizard level are unaffected. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
941813b3-647d-4667-9ba8-21a373555e0e: Enchantment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} affect the minds of others, influencing or controlling their behavior.
242da851-2a77-438a-8461-c5a0a6482947: Evocation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} manipulate magical energy or tap an unseen source of power to produce a desired end. In effect, an evocation draws upon magic to create something out of nothing. Many of these spells produce spectacular effects, and evocation spells can deal large amounts of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
2500c3ed-4733-4d01-b43a-0dedaa54f257:
Evokers revel in the raw power of magic, and can use it to create and destroy with shocking ease.
Intense Spells: Whenever you cast an evocation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that deals hit point {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, add 1/2 your wizard level to the damage (minimum +1). This {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} only applies once to a spell, not once per missile or ray, and cannot be split between multiple missiles or rays. This damage is of the same type as the spell. At 20th level, whenever you cast an Evocation spell, you can {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice to penetrate a creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} and take the better result.
Force Missile: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can unleash a force missile that automatically strikes a foe, as magic missile. The force missile deals 1d4 points of damage plus the damage from your intense spells evocation power. This is a force effect. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
Elemental Wall: At 8th level, one per day you can create a wall of energy. You can choose fire, cold, acid or {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}. The elemental wall otherwise functions like wall of fire. At 12th level and every 4 levels thereafter, you can use this ability one additional time per day, to a maximum of 4 times at level 20.
3a1d7977-38aa-4ca6-aa3d-6f1ae62efb95:
Forewarned: You receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1). At 20th level, anytime you {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} initiative, assume the roll resulted in a natural 20.
Diviner's Fortune: When you activate this school power, you can touch any creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to give it an insight bonus on all of its {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1) for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
ce51af3b-2b16-48d1-88fd-f4239c663dcd: Illusion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} deceive the senses or minds of others. They cause people to see things that are not there, not see things that are there, hear phantom noises, or remember things that never happened.
b5f3ba0a-7cc8-4322-ab0c-583c0b490931:
Illusionists use magic to weave confounding images, figments, and phantoms to baffle and vex their foes.
Blinding Ray : As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can fire a shimmering ray at any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. The ray causes creatures to be blinded for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Creatures with more {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} than your wizard level are dazzled for 1 round instead. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
Invisibility Field : At 8th level, you can make yourself Invisible as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} for a number of rounds per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive. This otherwise functions as greater invisibility.
bf31ee1c-db64-4b7f-b4f8-f883719da650: Metamagic Mastery — Extend and Reach Spell
1492fef9-0893-4ccd-a186-d6a9b50022ab: Necromancy {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} manipulate the power of death, unlife, and the life force. Spells involving undead creatures make up a large part of this school.
725dd6c0-7078-4c98-ad87-164e789705b8: On a direct hit, an arcane bomber's bomb inflicts {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the chosen energy type + additional damage equal to the arcane bomber's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. The damage of an arcane bomber's bomb increases by 1d6 points at every odd-numbered arcane bomber level. Splash damage from an arcane bomber's bomb is always equal to the bomb's minimum damage (so if the bomb would deal 2d6+4 points of damage of the chosen energy type on a direct hit, its splash damage would be 6 points of the same energy type). Those caught in the splash damage can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the arcane bomber's level + the arcane bomber's Intelligence modifier.
fa05546b-f1f9-4aac-8296-1d1d6c15c4ea: Physical Enhancement: You gain a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to one physical {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}). This bonus increases by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess to a maximum of +5 at 20th level. At 20th level, this bonus applies to two physical ability scores of your choice.
85aa23e2-3a63-424c-a114-d2345c357926: Some wizards consider scrolls a natural extension of their magical abilities.
f40ee916-7b58-442f-b0b8-67326ee6b055:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Envy focus on suppressing magic other than their own.
Prohibited Schools: Evocation, Necromancy.
62e949ba-a77e-4049-abc1-c5035ed74ead:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Gluttony seek to manipulate their bodies in their unending hunger for life.
Prohibited Schools: Abjuration, Enchantment.
56fd6c8b-0b6b-4bea-a7df-21bc373e5f00:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Greed delight in transforming things into other things, as well as enhancing themselves.
Prohibited Schools: Enchantment, Illusion.
44865b4e-1d3f-40d0-8ea5-e07a077ab73e:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Lust gain great personal satisfaction at manipulating others' minds, emotions, and wills.
Prohibited Schools: Necromancy, Transmutation.
5d59026e-2d22-4c91-9da3-fb910646b9c2:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Pride seek to perfect their own appearance and power through trickery and illusions.
Prohibited Schools: Conjuration, Transmutation.
afa3d2f7-f6b2-45f5-872f-5c3ed829cef4:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Sloth enlist agents and minions to perform their tasks, or create what is needed as it is needed.
Prohibited Schools: Evocation, Illusion.
146576ef-606b-4efa-8505-44ef43dd4ac1:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Wrath focus on complete mastery of the raw destructive power of magic, and delight in channeling those destructive forces in awesome displays.
Prohibited Schools: Abjuration, Conjuration.
06b8c240-2ae5-4343-b200-b39a5acd6404:
The abjurer uses magic against itself, and masters the art of defensive and warding magics.
Resistance: You gain resistance 5 to an energy type of your choice, chosen when you prepare {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. This resistance can be changed each day. At 11th level, this resistance increases to 10. At 20th level, this resistance changes to immunity to the chosen energy type.
Protective Ward: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can create a 10-foot-radius field of protective magic centered on you that lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. All allies in this area (including you) receive a +1 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier.
Energy Absorption: At 6th level, you gain an amount of energy absorption equal to 3 times your wizard level per day. Whenever you take {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g}, apply immunity, vulnerability (if any), and resistance first and apply the rest to this absorption, reducing your daily total by that amount. Any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} in excess of your absorption is applied to you normally.
012ac9f8-3389-47d7-9ecc-6b0b092ff0f2:
The conjurer focuses on the study of summoning monsters and magic alike to bend to his will.
Summoner's Charm: Whenever you cast a conjuration (summoning) {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, increase the duration by a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum 1). This increase is not doubled by Extend Spell.
Acid Dart: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can unleash an acid dart targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. The acid dart deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} + 1 for every two wizard levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. This {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} ignores {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}.
Dimensional Steps: At 8th level, you can use this ability to teleport up to 30 feet as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. You can use this ability a total number of times per day equal to your wizard level.
f8f33ab6-adeb-48cd-b048-a248db444dd2:
The dread and feared necromancer commands undead and uses the foul power of unlife against his enemies.
Power over Undead: You receive Turn Undead as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. You can channel energy a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier, but only to use this feat. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} against these feats is equal to 10 + 1/2 your wizard level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. At 20th level, undead cannot add their channel resistance to the save against this ability.
Grave Touch: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can make a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} that causes a living creature to become shaken for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum 1). If you touch a shaken creature with this ability, it becomes frightened for 1 round if it has fewer {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} than your wizard level. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier.
Life Sight: At 8th level, you gain blindsight to a range of 10 feet for a number of rounds per day equal to your wizard level. This ability only allows you to detect living creatures and undead creatures. This sight also tells you whether a creature is living or undead. Constructs and other creatures that are neither living nor undead cannot be seen with this ability. The range of this ability increases by 10 feet at 12th level, and by an additional 10 feet for every four levels beyond 12th. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
234d087a-38d2-443b-aca3-ec235d6989c5:
The enchanter uses magic to control and manipulate the minds of his victims.
Enchanting Smile: You gain a +2 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion checks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against Enchantment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess, up to a maximum of +6 at 20th level.
Dazing Touch: You can cause a living creature to become dazed for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. Creatures with more {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} than your wizard level are unaffected. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
Aura of Despair: At 8th level, you can emit a 30-foot aura of despair for a number of rounds per day equal to your wizard level. Enemies within this aura take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, saving throws, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. These rounds do not need to be consecutive. This is a mind-affecting effect.
99ccece6-65e3-47a8-95fa-64684c12c0a7:
The next {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} the wizard casts will be altered as though using the Reach Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. You can use this ability once per day at 8th level and one additional time per day for every two wizard levels you possess beyond 8th.
Reach Spell: You can alter a spell with a range of touch, close, or medium to increase its range by one range category, using the following order: touch, close, medium, and long. Spells modified by this feat that require melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} instead require ranged touch {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.
492ca406-0eac-4f72-ae72-1ed7fc3fd628:
The next {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} the wizard casts will be cast as if extended as though using the Extend Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. You can use this ability once per day at 8th level and one additional time per day for every two wizard levels you possess beyond 8th.
Extend Spell: An extended spell lasts twice as long as normal. A spell with a duration of {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration{/g}, instantaneous, or permanent is not affected by this feat.
5af9251c-d32e-47a0-849a-10e4c1adf304: To many wizards, the experimentation of the alchemist seems quaint, if not dangerous or frightening. A few wizards take up the secrets of the bomb, however, fusing alchemy with their already considerable magical power.
b5da6e3a-cbe3-4adc-abc4-0e48692a4e92: To those who know how to manipulate it, the blood of a dhampir can be a powerful component to magic. A cruoromancer infuses his necromantic magic with the power of his unique mixture of living blood and undead ichor. As his power increases in this strange arcane art, a cruoromancer finds potent ways to infuse his unique blood with Necromancy {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
4d7ef41f-98de-4996-ac22-a542de43fdf8: Transmutation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} change the properties of some creature, thing, or condition.
7dd9d3fb-3717-4325-b5ff-566c6cbbd73d:
Transmuters use magic to change the world around them.
Physical Enhancement: You gain a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to one physical {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}). This bonus increases by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess to a maximum of +5 at 20th level. At 20th level, this bonus applies to two physical ability scores of your choice.
Telekinetic Fist: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can strike with a telekinetic fist, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. The telekinetic fist deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} + 1 for every two wizard levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
Change Shape: At 8th level, you can change your shape for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive. This ability otherwise functions like beast shape II or elemental body I. At 12th level, this ability functions like beast shape III or elemental body II.
526f8528-b5b2-4a09-b349-763e872063c0: Usually wizards specialize in a {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}magic school{/g}, delivering greater impact in a focused manner, but {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} masters try to make their expertise as broad as possible.
77518b73-2be1-47af-8560-f915d4d4c022:
When a cruoromancer casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} of the necromancy school, he can opt to infuse that spell with his undead-tainted blood as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. As he increases in level, the power and effects of such infusions become more potent. Each time a cruoromancer uses blood infusion, he drains a portion of his own blood either by cutting himself with a blade or by opening a scab from a previous wound. When he does this, he takes an amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} + half his wizard level. A cruoromancer can only affect a spell with a single type of blood infusion.
At 1st level, he can infuse his Necromancy spells in either of the following ways:
Focused Infusion: When the cruoromancer uses this infusion, he adds +1 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the infused Necromancy spell.
Sickening Infusion: When the cruoromancer uses this infusion, any creature damaged by the infused Necromancy spell becomes sickened for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
195c698f-b4f3-4b55-a487-8ee87d38c5e1: When the cruoromancer uses this infusion, any creature {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaged{/g} by the infused Necromancy {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} becomes sickened for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
4686d0e2-6a31-486f-97df-05c9ff9a962b: When the cruoromancer uses this infusion, he adds +1 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the infused Necromancy {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
52d8be0d-62bb-4d39-80b9-7f23138845f7: When using this infusion with animate dead, the summoned skeletons gain a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} for the duration of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that summoned it.
f4c7b4e4-4bc6-494d-8b40-65989c16762b: When you activate this school power, you can touch any creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to give it an insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all of its {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1) for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
01fee1af-28eb-4148-a9d0-bf5378ee5b63:
While the concept of wizard specializations along the classically recognized {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}schools of magic{/g} certainly dates back to the time of Azlant, and perhaps beyond into the dim recesses of time before humanity rose to prominence, it was the runelords of Thassilon who explored school specialization to its full extreme.
Focusing their research on the discovery that each school of magic was opposed by two specific opposition schools, the runelords developed methods of further enhancing their mastery over their chosen arcane specialties. Essentially, they defined these seven schools as much by what they couldn't do as by what they could. By excising "impurities" introduced by fixed oppositional schools, they traded arcane versatility for greater strength in their chosen fields.
01fd67a3-6145-4d62-af78-df6fee7c7e18: While universalist wizards might study to prepare themselves for any manner of danger, specialist wizards research {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}schools of magic{/g} that make them exceptionally skilled within a specific focus. Yet no matter their specialty, all wizards are masters of the impossible and can aid their allies in overcoming any danger.
b8ab0cf1-5c0d-44c4-af29-09e4e5cf7a8f: Wizard can form a bond with either a magic item, or a familiar. A familiar grants them {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to certain abilities or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, while an item helps them replenish a used {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once a day.
5e70c7ce-253c-4548-93ed-d9431f9e444f: Wizard chooses a favored {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}school of magic{/g}, which grants them bonus abilities and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. However, they also choose two opposition schools, diminishing their ability of casting spells that belong to them.
476f8ebd-2a77-462e-946b-33f5d5fd63bb: Wizards are powerful arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g}. They have a large array of different spells, which makes them useful in different situations. They can destroy or weaken their enemies, or empower their allies. However, this versatility has its downside: the number of spells a wizard can cast per day is not very large.
6579705b-b33b-46d2-ad08-f2d7b7ec6db5: Wizards are proficient with the club, dagger, heavy crossbow, light crossbow, and quarterstaff, but not with any type of armor or shield. Armor interferes with a wizard's movements, which can cause his {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with somatic components to fail.
3f340a61-2cbe-4d61-b6d6-59d84057518f: Wizards can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
4d950a89-b63a-4934-b760-2baf236af2d4: Wizards can expand their arsenal of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} by copying them from scrolls into their spellbook.
de589a58-bd69-469e-99a9-49f030cfcfd5: Wizards sometimes specialize in utilizing one element, converting other elements into their own.
e72b35fc-6309-44dd-bae2-de1615217df9:
Wizards who do not specialize (known as universalists) have the most diversity of all arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g}.
Hand of the Apprentice: You cause your melee weapon to fly from your grasp and strike a foe before instantly returning to you. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} using a melee weapon at a range of 30 feet. This attack is treated as a {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} with a thrown weapon, except that you add your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier on the attack roll instead of your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier ({g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} still relies on {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}). This ability cannot be used to perform a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier.
Metamagic Mastery: At 8th level, you can extend or alter the range of your next spell as though using the Extend or Reach spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} accordingly. You can use this ability once per day at 8th level and one additional time per day for every two wizard levels you possess beyond 8th.
Extend spell: An extended spell lasts twice as long as normal. A spell with a duration of {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration{/g}, instantaneous, or permanent is not affected by this feat.
Reach spell: You can alter a spell with a range of touch, close, or medium to increase its range by one range category, using the following order: touch, close, medium, and long. Spells modified by this feat that require melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} instead require ranged touch attacks.
At 12th level, you can empower your next spell as though using the Empower Spell feat. Empowering costs 2 daily usages of metamagic mastery.
Empowered spell: All variable, numeric effects of an empowered spell are increased by half including {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to those {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}dice{/g} rolls. {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Saving throws{/g} and opposed rolls are not affected, nor are spells without random variables.
At 16th level, you can maximize your next spell as though using the Maximize Spell feat. Maximizing costs 3 daily usages of metamagic mastery.
Maximized spell: All variable, numeric effects of a spell modified by this feat are maximized. Saving throws and opposed rolls are not affected, nor are spells without random variables.
At 20th level, you can quicken your next spell as though using the Quicken Spell feat. Quickening costs 4 daily usages of metamagic mastery.
Quicken Spell: Casting a quickened spell is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. You can perform another {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, even casting another spell, in the same {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as you cast a quickened spell. A spell whose {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g} is more than 1 round or 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} cannot be quickened.
4871b0e6-6fee-4b47-848a-7084d8988b5e: You can cause a living creature to become dazed for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}.
